Text: Sorry to keep you waiting.
My lord...is that...
...a...watermelon?
Cid brings a large watermelon.

Yeah, it's just a regular watermelon. It's pretty big
and impressive for a fruit, isn't it?

My lord, did you wish to eat watermelon? If you had
told me, I would have prepared one that was already
cut...

Ah, no, it's not like that. This one is meant for
play. It's supposed to be uncut.

It's a game called "Watermelon Smashing." Have either
of you played it before?

Watermelon Smashing... This is the first I've heard
about it.
It's a new game of wisdom?
That's right. I'll explain the rules.

Cid explains the rules of Watermelon Smashing to
Beta and Epsilon.

...That's pretty much it. So basically, you listen to
the onlookers' directions while blindfolded, and you
use the stick to try to smash the watermelon.
...Got it?
Yes, I understand!
I understand as well, but...
What is it?

I don't mean to be presumptuous, but with our
abilities, wouldn't it be easy to close our eyes,
sense the watermelon's presence, and smash it
with ease?
Hmm...

(...Wait? Seriously? Did my whole game just fall
apart?)

W-Well, you won't know until you try, right?
Let's give it a swing.
Can you close your eyes and count to around 20?
Understood. Here goes...

Epsilon begins counting to twenty. Meanwhile, Cid quickly
places the watermelon a short distance away and
returns to his original position.
Nineteen...twenty. Okay, I'm done counting.
Now then, time to sense the watermelon's presence...
Hmm?

Huh... Even with my heightened magic detection and
senses, I can't pick up on anything... Why?

...How about it? Were you able to sense the
watermelon's location?

N-No... Continuing on like this would be futile,
so I'll stop here.
Epsilon slowly opens her eyes.

Wow... It was so close to me, but I couldn't sense it
at all.

Well, it's supposed to be a game where you rely on
people's voices, so I'm glad you couldn't sense it.
I-I see. Watermelon Smashing, huh...
Have you picked up on something, Beta?

...It's just a guess, but our usual targets have some
trace of magic energy or presence we can pick up
on, such as their breathing or bloodlust.

But this is just a regular watermelon. Since our
target doesn't emit any presence, we don't have
any clues to grasp.

I-I see! So, this is wisdom born from combat training
with no vision! Watermelon Smashing...is profound!

There are no bounds to the depth of Master Shadow's
wisdom!
Um...sure.
(Let's just go with that...)
In that case, let's do this! I'll go first!
Alright, I'm gonna blindfold you.
Eek! Being blindfolded...is kind of exciting.
*gasp* No fair!
...Stay calm...Beta... Next is your turn.
Yup, yup. That's right.

Oh, I remember how to tie the blindfold, so I can do
it when it's Beta's turn, my lord!
Oh, really? I'll leave it to you then.
...Wha—? No way!
Epsilon...you'll pay for that!

Cid covers Epsilon's eyes with a cloth, sets down the
watermelon, and adjusts its position. Then, he steps
back and calls out.
Alright, let's get started!

Since you're here, Beta, why don't you guide her?
It's fun being the one giving instructions. Give it a
try.
Oh, okay. Understood... Heheh.
Epsilon plunges into the sea.
Epsilon returns to Cid and Beta.
...Hey! You totally did that on purpose, Beta!

Wh-What?! No, I didn't mean to... It's just pretty
hard giving directions...
...I'll remember what you did! Next is your turn!

With bad vibes lingering between the two, it is now
Beta's turn to try smashing the watermelon...
